description: Successfully enabled CUDA GPU acceleration in WSL2! Installed CUDA Toolkit 12.6 and cuDNN 9.5.1 for Ubuntu 24.04 on WSL2. Configured LD_LIBRARY_PATH in ~/.zshrc. Julie now detects CUDA libraries and runs with GPU acceleration (batch_size=50 on 6GB RTX A1000). Key insight: WSL2 uses Windows NVIDIA driver passthrough, so only CUDA toolkit (libraries/headers) needed, not driver. Fixed zsh vs bash configuration issue. GPU acceleration confirmed in logs: 'CUDA execution provider registered successfully' and 'GPU acceleration active'.
